{{cpp/experimental/fs/path/title|parent_path}}
{{cpp/experimental/fs/path/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=fs_ts|1=
path parent_path() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns the path to the parent directory. Returns empty path if {{c|empty()}} or there's only a single element in the path ({{c|1=begin() == --end()}}).

The resulting path is constructed by appending all elements in a range {{range|begin()|--end()}} to an empty path.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The path to the parent directory.

{{cpp/impldef exception}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;experimental/filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
namespace fs = std::experimental::filesystem;

int main()
{
    for (fs::path p : {"/var/tmp/example.txt", "/", "/var/tmp/."})
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "The parent path of " &lt;&lt; p
                  &lt;&lt; " is " &lt;&lt; p.parent_path() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
The parent path of "/var/tmp/example.txt" is "/var/tmp"
The parent path of "/" is ""
The parent path of "/var/tmp/." is "/var/tmp"
}}
